children.value: Policy Reporter supports different targets to send new PolicyReport results. This makes it possible to create a log or get notified as soon as a new validation result is detected. The set of supported tools are based on personal needs and user requests. Feel free to create an issue or pull request if you want support for a new target.
Each Target has similar configuration values. Required is always a valid and accessible
configuration to be able to send the events.
Different optional configurations allow you to define which results should be send to the given target. These configurations are available for every target and can be used together with
to route notifications to various clients of the same type of target.
Only events with the given priority or higher are sent. By default each priority is sent. See
Send only results of the configured sources. By default results from all sources are sent.
On startup, Policy Reporter registers all existing results in the cluster. By default these results are ignored. If you also want to send them to your target, you can set this option to
The new filter option allows you to define include and exclude rules for the namespaces, policies and priorities of a result. Filters for namespaces and policies have wildcard support.

props.code:
slack:
  webhook: "https://hooks.slack.com/services/123..."
  skipExistingOnStartup: true
  filter:
    namespaces:
      include: ["team-a-*"]
    priorities:
      exclude: ["info", "debug"]
    policies:
      include: ["require-*"]

children.value: option allows you to define multiple configurations of the same type of target. Thus, in combination with filters, you can route your notifications to different target configurations. Channels have the same configuration properties as the root target configuration.
See the different available targets for concrete example and usage of
Instead of defining your credentials or webhooks directly, you can also use the
configuration to define an already existing
by name. If the secret does not exist, the target is skipped.
The Secret should contain the related configuration as
. Supported keys are host, webhook, username, password, token, credentials, accessKeyID and secretAccessKey - depending on the related target. Only exception is
targets and is added as Authorization header.
is also supported for channels, so you can use different secrets for different channels.

props.code:
# values.yaml
target:
  slack:
    minimumPriority: "warning"
    skipExistingOnStartup: true
    channels:
    # secretRef configuration
    - secretRef: "team-a-slack-webhook"
      filter:
        namespaces:
          include: ["team-a-*"]
    # inline configuration
    - webhook: "https://hooks.slack.com/services/456..."
      filter:
        namespaces:
          include: ["team-b-*"]

apiVersion: v1
kind: Secret
metadata:
  name: team-a-slack-webhook
type: Opaque
data:
  webhook: aHR0cHM6Ly9ob29rcy5zbGFjay5jb20vc2VydmljZXMvVDAuLi4= # https://hooks.slack.com/services/T0...

children.value: targets. Can be used to configure the
to your custom certificate, added over
targets. Can be used to skip the TLS check.
Policy Reporter can send results directly to Grafana Loki without the need of Promtail. Each result includes all available information as labels as well as a
as value. To query all messages from Policy Reporter, use
The minimal configuration for Grafana Loki requires a valid and accessible host.

props.code:
loki:
  host: "http://loki.loki-stack:3100"
  path: "/loki/api/v1/push"
  minimumPriority: "warning"
  skipExistingOnStartup: true
  sources:
  - kyverno

children.value: configuration as the root target if not defined.
Send notification based on namespace prefix with a related Team label

props.code:
loki:
  host: "http://loki.loki-stack:3100"
  path: "/loki/api/v1/push"
  minimumPriority: "warning"
  skipExistingOnStartup: true
  channels:
  - filter:
      namespaces:
        include: ["teame-a-*"]
    customLabels:
      team: "Team A"
  - filter:
      namespaces:
        include: ["teame-b-*"]
    customLabels:
      team: "Team B"

children.value: Policy Reporter sends results in a JSON representation and all available information to a customizable index. This index can be expanded by selecting one of the different rotations or
to disable this function. By default Policy Reporter creates a new index on a daily basis.
is used as an index name. Uses
is used to create rotating indexes by adding the rotation date as suffix to the index name. Possible values are
to use HTTP Basic Auth based authentication.
The minimal configuration for Elasticsearch requires a valid and accessible host.

props.code:
elasticsearch:
  host: "http://elasticsearch.elk-stack:8080"
  index: "policy-reporter"
  rotation: "daily"
  minimumPriority: "warning"
  skipExistingOnStartup: true
  sources:
  - kyverno

children.value: configuration as the root target if not defined.
Send only critical notifications to a different index with a daily rotation

props.code:
elasticsearch:
  host: "http://elasticsearch.elk-stack:8080"
  index: "policy-reporter"
  rotation: "weekly"
  minimumPriority: "warning"
  skipExistingOnStartup: true
  filter:
    priorities:
      exclude: ["critical"]
  channels:
  - index: "critical-violations"
    rotation: "daily"
    filter:
      priorities:
        include: ["critical"]

children.value: Send new PolicyReportResults with all available information over the webhook API to Microsoft Teams.
The minimal configuration for Microsoft Teams requires a valid and accessible webhook URL.

props.code:
teams:
  webhook: "https://m365x682156.webhook.office.com"
  minimumPriority: "critical"
  skipExistingOnStartup: true
  sources:
  - kyverno

children.value: configuration as the root target if not defined.
Send notification based on namespace prefix to a dedicated Teams Channel

props.code:
teams:
  minimumPriority: "warning"
  skipExistingOnStartup: true
  channels:
  - webhook: "https://m365x682156.webhook.office.com/1"
    filter:
      namespaces:
        include: ["team-a-*"]
  - webhook: "https://m365x682156.webhook.office.com/2"
    filter:
      namespaces:
        include: ["team-b-*"]

props.alt: MS Teams Notification for a PolicyReportResult

children.value: Send new PolicyReportResults with all available information over the webhook API to Slack.
The minimal configuration for Slack requires a valid and accessible webhook URL.

props.code:
slack:
  webhook: "https://hooks.slack.com/services/..."
  minimumPriority: "critical"
  skipExistingOnStartup: true
  sources:
  - kyverno

children.value: configuration as the root target if not defined.
Send notification based on namespace prefix to a dedicated Slack Channel

props.code:
slack:
  minimumPriority: "warning"
  skipExistingOnStartup: true
  channels:
  - webhook: "https://hooks.slack.com/services/T1..."
    filter:
      namespaces:
        include: ["team-a-*"]
  - webhook: "https://hooks.slack.com/services/T2..."
    filter:
      namespaces:
        include: ["team-b-*"]

The minimal configuration for Discord requires a valid and accessible webhook URL.

props.code:
discord:
  webhook: "https://discordapp.com/api/webhooks/..."
  minimumPriority: "critical"
  skipExistingOnStartup: true
  sources:
  - kyverno

children.value: configuration as the root target if not defined.
Send notification based on namespace prefix to a dedicated Discord Channel

props.code:
discord:
  minimumPriority: "warning"
  skipExistingOnStartup: true
  channels:
  - webhook: "https://discordapp.com/api/webhooks/1..."
    filter:
      namespaces:
        include: ["team-a-*"]
  - webhook: "https://discordapp.com/api/webhooks/2..."
    filter:
      namespaces:
        include: ["team-b-*"]

children.value: Send new PolicyReportResults with all available information as JSON to the REST API of Policy Reporter UI. You can find the received Results in the
view of the UI. The results are stored in memory. The max number of stored results can be configured in the Policy Reporter UI.
If the Policy Reporter UI is installed via Helm Chart, it is configured as a target by default with a minimumPriority of
. The logSize can be configured in the
The minimal configuration for Policy Reporter UI requires a valid and accessible host URL.

props.code:
ui:
  host: "http://policy-reporter-ui:8080"
  minimumPriority: "warning"
  skipExistingOnStartup: true
  sources:
  - kyverno

props.alt: Policy Reporter UI - Logs View dark mode
Policy Reporter UI - Logs View light mode

children.value: Send new PolicyReportResults with all available information as JSON POST request to a custom API with extendable header information.
The minimal configuration for Webhook requires a valid and accessible host URL.

props.code:
webhook:
  host: "http://webhook.de:8080"
  headers:
    Authorization: "Bearer XXXXXX"
  minimumPriority: "warning"
  skipExistingOnStartup: true
  sources:
  - kyverno

children.value: configuration as the root target if not defined. Root
will be merged together with the defined channel
Send notification based on namespace prefix to a dedicated Webhook URL

props.code:
webhook:
  minimumPriority: "warning"
  skipExistingOnStartup: true
  headers:
    Authorization: "Bearer XXXXXX"
  channels:
  - host: "https://webhook.team-a.de"
    filter:
      namespaces:
        include: ["team-a-*"]
  - host: "https://webhook.team-b.de"
    filter:
      namespaces:
        include: ["team-b-*"]

Policy Reporter can also send results to S3 compatible services like
It persists each result as JSON in the following structure:
In case of AWS S3, authentication via IRSA is supported. It requires the
for authentication with the required write permissions for the selected bucket
in which the results are persisted

props.code:
s3:
  endpoint: "https://storage.yandexcloud.net"
  region: "ru-central1"
  bucket: "dev-cluster"
  secretAccessKey: "secretAccessKey"
  accessKeyID: "accessKeyID"
  minimumPriority: "warning"
  skipExistingOnStartup: true
  sources:
  - kyverno

children.value: configuration as the root target if not defined.
Send critical results for a given policy to a dedicated AWS S3 bucket

props.code:
s3:
  endpoint: "https://s3.amazonaws.com"
  region: "eu-central-1"
  bucket: "policy-violations"
  secretAccessKey: "secretAccessKey"
  accessKeyID: "accessKeyID"
  skipExistingOnStartup: true
  channels:
  - bucket: "privileged-containers-violations"
    filter:
      priorities:
        include: ["critical"]
      policies:
        include: ["disallow-privileged-containers"]
  sources:
  - kyverno

In case of AWS Kinesis, authentication via IRSA is supported. It requires the
for authentication with the required write permissions for the selected stream
in which the results are send to

props.code:
kinesis:
  endpoint: "https://kinesis.eu-central-1.amazonaws.com"
  region: "eu-central-1"
  streamName: "policy-reporter"
  secretAccessKey: "secretAccessKey"
  accessKeyID: "accessKeyID"
  minimumPriority: "warning"
  skipExistingOnStartup: true
  sources:
  - kyverno

      policies:
        include: ["disallow-privileged-containers"]

  - kyverno

Policy Reporter can also send results to the AWS SecurityHub.
In case of AWS S3, authentication via IRSA is supported. It requires the
ENV vars to be available. If you are using IRSA auth, the AccountID is optional.
for authentication with the required write permissions for AWS SecurityHub

props.code:
securityHub:
  region: "eu-central-1"
  accountID: "account_id"
  secretAccessKey: "secretAccessKey"
  accessKeyID: "accessKeyID"
  minimumPriority: "warning"
  skipExistingOnStartup: true
  sources:
  - kyverno

children.value: configuration as the root target if not defined.
Send critical results for a given policy to a dedicated AWS Kinesis Stream

props.code:
securityHub:
  region: "eu-central-1"
  accountID: "account_id"
  secretAccessKey: "secretAccessKey"
  accessKeyID: "accessKeyID"
  skipExistingOnStartup: true
  channels:
  - region: "us-east-1"
    filter:
      priorities:
        include: ["critical"]
      policies:
        include: ["disallow-privileged-containers"]
  sources:
  - kyverno
